description:
Open accommodation establishments

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
45412 Monthly tourism survey

Definition:
Local units providing private or business tourism guests
with overnight accommodation. A distinction is made between
accommodation establishments providing bed places (e.g.
hotels and guest houses) and tourist camp-sites offering
camping pitches for overnight stays. Accommodation
establishments also include accommodation facilities that
are run on a part-time basis.

There is a break in the time series from reference month
January 2012. This is due to an amendment of the
Accommodation Statistics Act which now provides for a new
survey cut-off threshold in line with the relevant new EU
regulation relating to tourism statistics. The number of bed
places has been raised from nine to ten for accommodation
establishments and that of camping pitches from three to ten
for tourist camp-sites.
To facilitate year-on-year comparisons, the monthly results
for 2011 were recalculated as required.
